verses.verse: Therefore<WH199>, Job<WH347>, I pray you<WH8085>, hear my speeches<WH4405>, and listen<WH238> to all my words<WH1697>.
Behold<WH6605>, now I have opened my mouth<WH6310>, my tongue<WH3956> has spoken<WH1696> in my mouth<WH2441>.
My words<WH561> shall be of the uprightness<WH3476> of my heart<WH3820>: and my lips<WH8193> shall utter<WH4448> knowledge<WH1847> clearly<WH1305>.
The Spirit<WH7307> of God<WH410> has made<WH6213> me<WH5397>, and the breath of the Almighty<WH7706> has given me life<WH2421>.
If you can<WH3201> answer<WH7725> me<WH6186>, set your words in order before<WH6440> me<WH3320>, stand up.
Behold<WH6310>, I am according to your wish in God<WH410>'s place<WH7169>: I also am formed out of the clay<WH2563>.
Behold<WH367>, my terror shall not make you afraid<WH1204>, neither shall my hand<WH405> be heavy upon you<WH3513>.
Surely you have spoken<WH559> in my hearing<WH241>, and I have heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of your words<WH4405>, saying,
I am clean<WH2134> without transgression<WH6588>, I am innocent<WH2643>; neither is there iniquity in me<WH5771>.
Behold<WH4672>, he finds occasions<WH8569> against me<WH2803>, he counts me for his enemy<WH341>,
He puts<WH7760> my feet<WH7272> in the stocks<WH5465>, he marks<WH8104> all my paths<WH734>.
Behold<WH6663>, in this you are not just: I will answer<WH6030> you<WH433>, that God is greater<WH7235> than man<WH582>.
Why do you argue<WH7378> against him<WH6030>? for he gives not account of any of his matters<WH1697>.
For God<WH410> speaks<WH1696> once<WH259>, Yes twice<WH8147>, yet man perceives it not<WH7789>.
In a dream<WH2472>, in a vision<WH2384> of the night<WH3915>, when deep<WH8639> sleep falls<WH5307> upon men<WH582>, in slumberings<WH8572> upon the bed<WH4904>;
Then he opens<WH1540> the ears<WH241> of men<WH582>, and seals<WH2856> their instruction<WH4561>,
That he may withdraw<WH5493> man<WH120> from his purpose<WH4639>, and hide<WH3680> pride<WH1466> from man<WH1397>.
He keeps back<WH2820> his soul<WH5315> from the pit<WH7845>, and his life<WH2416> from perishing<WH5674> by the sword<WH7973>.
He is chastened<WH3198> also with pain<WH4341> upon his bed<WH4904>, and the multitude<WH7230> of his bones<WH6106> with strong pain<WH386>:
So that his life<WH2416> abhors<WH2092> bread<WH3899>, and his soul<WH5315> dainty<WH8378> food<WH3978>.
His flesh<WH1320> is consumed away<WH3615>, that it cannot be seen<WH7210>; and his bones<WH6106> that were not seen<WH7200> stick out<WH8192>.
Yes<WH5315>, his soul draws near<WH7126> unto the grave<WH7845>, and his life<WH2416> to the destroyers<WH4191>.
If there<WH3426> be a messenger<WH4397> with him<WH3887>, an interpreter, one<WH259> among a thousand<WH505>, to show<WH5046> unto man<WH120> his uprightness<WH3476>:
Then he is gracious<WH2603> unto him<WH559>, and says, Deliver<WH6308> him from going down<WH3381> to the pit<WH7845>: I have found<WH4672> a ransom<WH3724>.
His flesh<WH1320> shall be fresher<WH7375> than a child<WH5290>'s: he shall return<WH7725> to the days<WH3117> of his youth<WH5934>:

He shall pray<WH6279> unto God<WH433>, and he will be favorable<WH7521> unto him<WH7200>: and he shall see his face<WH6440> with joy<WH8643>: for he will render<WH7725> unto man<WH582> his righteousness<WH6666>.
He looks<WH7789> upon men<WH582>, and if any say<WH559>, I have sinned<WH2398>, and perverted<WH5753> that which was right<WH3477>, and it profited me not<WH7737>;
He will deliver<WH6299> his soul<WH5315> from going<WH5674> into the pit<WH7845>, and his life<WH2416> shall see<WH7200> the light<WH216>.
Behold<WH6466>, all these things works God<WH410> oftentimes<WH6471> with man<WH1397>,
To bring back<WH7725> his soul<WH5315> from the pit<WH7845>, to be enlightened<WH215> with the light<WH216> of the living<WH2416>.
Mark well<WH7181>, O Job<WH347>, listen<WH8085> unto me<WH2790>: hold your peace, and I will speak<WH1696>.
If you have<WH3426> any thing to say<WH4405>, answer<WH7725> me<WH1696>: speak, for I desire<WH2654> to justify you<WH6663>.
If not<WH8085>, listen unto me<WH2790>: hold your peace, and I shall teach<WH502> you wisdom<WH2451>.
